title: Authors and Citation
text: Lennart Schneider. Maintainer, author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Schneider L (2023). eagga: EA GGA. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://sumny.github.io/eagga/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {eagga: EA GGA},   author = {Lennart Schneider},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://sumny.github.io/eagga/}, }

title: EA GGA
text: official implemention EAGGA algorithm introduced paper ‘Multi-Objective Optimization Performance Interpretability Tabular Supervised Machine Learning Models’. Toy example: Notes: Check best store xgboost models etc. Maybe introduce helper construct suitable GraphLearner Vignette classif regr example
code: library(mlr3) library(mlr3learners) library(mlr3pipelines) library(mlr3tuning) library(eagga)  task = tsk("spam")  resampling = rsmp("cv", folds = 3)  learner = as_learner(po("colapply") %>>% po("select") %>>% po("sortfeatures") %>>% lrn("classif.xgboost")) learner$param_set$values$classif.xgboost.booster = "gbtree" learner$param_set$values$classif.xgboost.tree_method = "exact" learner$param_set$values$colapply.applicator = function(x) - x  measures = msrs(c("classif.ce", "selected_features_proxy", "selected_interactions_proxy", "selected_non_monotone_proxy"))  terminator = trm("evals", n_evals = 220)  search_space = ps(   classif.xgboost.nrounds = p_dbl(lower = log(1), upper = log(5000), tags = c("int", "log"),                                   trafo = function(x) as.integer(round(exp(x))), default = log(500)),   classif.xgboost.eta = p_dbl(lower = log(1e-4), upper = log(1), tags = "log",                               trafo = function(x) exp(x), default = log(0.3)),   classif.xgboost.gamma = p_dbl(lower = log(1e-4), upper = log(7), tags = "log",                                 trafo = function(x) exp(x), default = log(1e-4)),   classif.xgboost.lambda = p_dbl(lower = log(1e-4), upper = log(1000), tags = "log",                                  trafo = function(x) exp(x), default = log(1)),   classif.xgboost.alpha = p_dbl(lower = log(1e-4), upper = log(1000), tags = "log",                                 trafo = function(x) exp(x), default = log(1e-4)),   classif.xgboost.subsample = p_dbl(lower = 0.1, upper = 1, default = 1),   classif.xgboost.max_depth = p_int(lower = 1, upper = 20, default = 6),   classif.xgboost.min_child_weight = p_dbl(lower = log(1), upper = log(150), tags = "log",                                            trafo = function(x) exp(x), default = log(exp(1))),   classif.xgboost.colsample_bytree = p_dbl(lower = 0.01, upper = 1, default = 1),   classif.xgboost.colsample_bylevel = p_dbl(lower = 0.01, upper = 1, default = 1),   select.selector = p_uty(),  # must be part of the search space   classif.xgboost.interaction_constraints = p_uty(),  # must be part of the search space   classif.xgboost.monotone_constraints = p_uty()  # must be part of the search space )  instance = TuningInstanceMultiCrit$new(   task = task,   learner = learner,   resampling = resampling,    measures = measures,   terminator = terminator,   search_space = search_space,   store_models = TRUE )  tuner = tnr("eagga",   learner_id = "classif.xgboost",   select_id = "select.selector",   interaction_id = "classif.xgboost.interaction_constraints",   monotone_id = "classif.xgboost.monotone_constraints",   mu = 100,   lambda = 10,   seed_calculate_proxy_measures = 1 )  tuner$optimize(instance)  instance$archive$best()  trained_learner = reconstruct_eagga_model(instance, tuner = tuner, model_uhash = instance$archive$best()$uhash[1])  groupstructure = instance$archive$best()$groupstructure[1][[1]] groupstructure$selected_features groupstructure$get_groups() groupstructure$monotone_features  library(iml) trained_learner$predict_type = "prob" predictor = Predictor$new(trained_learner, data = task$data(cols = task$feature_names), y = task$data(cols = task$target_names)[[1]]) ale_unused = FeatureEffect$new(predictor, feature = groupstructure$unselected_features[1]) plot(ale_unused) ale_used_mon = FeatureEffect$new(predictor, feature = groupstructure$monotone_features[monotonicity == 1]$feature[1]) plot(ale_used_mon) ale_used_unc = FeatureEffect$new(predictor, feature = groupstructure$monotone_features[monotonicity == 0]$feature[1]) plot(ale_used_unc)

title: Group Structure — GroupStructure
text: Class represent group structure.

title: Group Structure — GroupStructure
text: feature_names (character())  names features mlr3::Task.

title: Group Structure — GroupStructure
text: n_features (integer(1)) Number features part mlr3::Task. n_selected (integer(1)) Number selected features based group structure. selected_features (character()) Names selected features. unselected_features (character()) Names unselected features. n_groups (integer(1)) Number groups group structure. Determined based number equivalence classes + 1 (due first group unselected features also always accounted ). monotone_features (data.table::data.table) data.table many rows features feature column indicating feature monotonicity column indicating monotonicity constraint integer (NA indicating constraint, e.g., unselected features). groups (list()) list containing character vector features ($features), integer vector equivalence classes ($eqcs) integer vector indicating belonging feature class ($belonging). monotone_eqcs (data.table::data.table) data.table many rows equivalence classes eqcs column indicating equivalence class monotonicity column indicating monotonicity constraint integer (NA indicating constraint, e.g., group unselected features). allow_all_unselected (logical(1)) Whether unselecting features allowed .e., single group unselected features considered valid group structure.

title: Interaction Detector — InteractionDetector
text: Detects important pairwise interactions using simple interaction detector inspired sophisticated methodology proposed Lou et al. (2013). contrast original FAST algorithm, detector crude implementation. discretizes features based relatively small grid sizes, unique grid values used potential cut points find best pair cut points feature pair results largest decrease residual sum squares. Additionally, please note targets simply converted numeric values case mlr3::TaskClassif, instead working logits model outputs previously computed proxy model. Overall, important remember detector solely used initialize group structures initial population within TunerEAGGA. Therefore, impreciseness acceptable. interaction detector works integer numeric features. Logical features must converted integers.

title: Interaction Detector — InteractionDetector
text: Lou, Yin, Caruana, Rich, Gehrke, Johannes, Hooker, Giles (2013). “Accurate Intelligible Models Pairwise Interactions.” Proceedings 19th ACM SIGKDD International Conference Knowledge Discovery Data Mining, 623--631.

title: Interaction Detector — InteractionDetector
text: xs (data.table::data.table) Data.table features mlr3::Task. Note feature values feature discretized based corresponding feature grid $grids. n_features (integer(1)) Number features mlr3::Task. feature_names (character())  Names features mlr3::Task. feature_types (character())  Original types features mlr3::Task prior discretization. y (numeric()) Numeric target vector mlr3::Task. case mlr3::TaskClassif, label simply converted numeric. grids (list()) List grids containing grid feature. Grids constructed computing quantiles feature probabilities ranging seq(= 0, = 1, length.= grid_size). integer features, resulting quantiles rounded nearest integer, unique values taken, may result grid smaller size grid_size. cuts (list()) List cut points containing cut points feature. Cut points features based unique values discretization using corresponding grid. rss (matrix()) Symmetric numeric matrix dimensions n_features n_features containing reduction residual sum squares pair features. NULL construction. compute , use $compute_best_rss.

title: Interaction Detector — InteractionDetector
text: InteractionDetector$new() InteractionDetector$compute_best_rss() InteractionDetector$get_eqcs_from_top_k() InteractionDetector$clone()

title: Interaction Detector — InteractionDetector
text: Creates new instance R6 class.

title: Interaction Detector — InteractionDetector
text: task (mlr3::Task) task. grid_size (integer(1)) grid size used construct grid feature. default value 11. grid feature constructed computing quantiles feature probabilities ranging seq(= 0, = 1, length.= grid_size). least three unique grid values can found based quantiles (resulting least two bins discretized feature), range feature split two intervals equal width, corresponding interval points used grid values fallback. integer features, resulting quantiles rounded nearest integer. Grid values always assumed unique. Therefore, actual number unique grid values may smaller grid_size.

text: Method compute reduction residual sum squares pair features, overwriting $rss.

title: Monotonicity Detector — MonotonicityDetector
text: Detects whether feature monotone increasing decreasing effect (enforced) quantifies tendency monotone relationship feature target. detector utilizes decision trees fit feature target variable using subsampled data calculates Spearman's Rho predicted values (numeric regression probability positive class binary classification) feature. Spearman's Rho values serve indicators presence monotone relationship features target can also help infer sign feature constrained monotone effect. Note detector works integer numeric features. Logical features must converted integers.

title: Monotonicity Detector — MonotonicityDetector
text: task (mlr3::Task) task. n_features (integer(1)) number features mlr3::Task. feature_names (character())  names features mlr3::Task. feature_types (character())  types features mlr3::Task. rho_table (data.table::data.table) data.table many rows features. "feature_name" column indicating feature "rho" column indicating Spearman's Rho. unconstrained_weight_table (data.table::data.table) data.table many rows features. "feature_name" column indicating feature "unconstrained_weight" column indicating 1 minus absolute Spearman's Rho rescaled range [0.2, 0.8].

title: Monotonicity Detector — MonotonicityDetector
text: Fits decision tree feature target variable using subsampled data calculates Spearman's Rho predicted values (numeric regression probability positive class binary classification) feature. process repeated feature ten times, average Spearman's Rho values stored $rho_table. subsampling fraction set 0.9, decision tree used standard mlr3::LearnerRegr mlr3::LearnerClassif.

title: Probs — Probs
text: Class represent probabilities used mutation crossover operations.

title: Probs — Probs
text: class provides convenient way manage update probabilities used mutation crossover operations. allows set individual probabilities various operations, overall mutation, overall crossover, parameter mutation, parameter crossover, group structure mutation. Future flexible classes likely inherit base class.

title: Probs — Probs
text: p_overall_mutate (numeric(1)) Numeric value 0 1 specifying overall mutation probability. p_overall_crossover (numeric(1)) Numeric value 0 1 specifying overall crossover probability. p_param_mutate (numeric(1)) Numeric value 0 1 specifying hyperparameter mutation probability. p_param_crossover (numeric(1)) Numeric value 0 1 specifying hyperparameter crossover probability. p_groupstructure_mutate (numeric(1)) Numeric value 0 1 specifying group structure mutation probability. p_groupstructure_crossover (numeric(1)) Numeric value 0 1 specifying group structure crossover probability.

title: Probs — Probs
text: p_overall_mutate (numeric(1)) Numeric value 0 1 specifying overall mutation probability. default value 0.3. p_overall_crossover (numeric(1)) Numeric value 0 1 specifying overall crossover probability. overall crossover probability also used group structure crossover probability. default value 0.7. p_param_mutate (numeric(1)) Numeric value 0 1 specifying hyperparameter mutation probability. default value 0.2. p_param_crossover (numeric(1)) Numeric value 0 1 specifying hyperparameter crossover probability. default value 0.5. p_groupstructure_mutate (numeric(1)) Numeric value 0 1 specifying group structure mutation probability. default value 0.2.

what: Multi-objective Hyperparameter Optimization, Feature Selection, Interaction, and Monotonicity Constraints — mlr_tuner_eagga
title: Multi-objective Hyperparameter Optimization, Feature Selection, Interaction, and Monotonicity Constraints — mlr_tuner_eagga
text: Performs joint multi-objective optimization hyperparameters, feature selection, interaction constraints, monotonicity constraints suitable mlr3::Learner. tuner requires appropriate mlr3::Learner supports feature selection, interaction constraints, monotonicity constraints. Currently, XGBoost learners (mlr3learners::LearnerRegrXgboost mlr3learners::LearnerClassifXgboost) supported.

title: Multi-objective Hyperparameter Optimization, Feature Selection, Interaction, and Monotonicity Constraints — mlr_tuner_eagga
text: Tuner can instantiated via dictionary mlr_tuners associated sugar function tnr():

title: Multi-objective Hyperparameter Optimization, Feature Selection, Interaction, and Monotonicity Constraints — mlr_tuner_eagga
text: select_id (character) ID parameter Learner controls feature selection. interaction_id (character) ID parameter Learner sets interaction constraints. monotone_id (character) ID parameter Learner sets monotonicity constraints. mu (integer) Population size. lambda (integer) Offspring size generation.

title: Multi-objective Hyperparameter Optimization, Feature Selection, Interaction, and Monotonicity Constraints — mlr_tuner_eagga
text: $optimize() supports progress bars via package progressr combined Terminator. Simply wrap function progressr::with_progress() enable . recommend use package progress backend; enable progressr::handlers("progress").

title: Multi-objective Hyperparameter Optimization, Feature Selection, Interaction, and Monotonicity Constraints — mlr_tuner_eagga

title: Reconstructs an EAGGA model from a Tuning Instance — reconstruct_eagga_model
Reconstructs an EAGGA model from a Tuning Instance — reconstruct_eagga_model
text: instance (mlr3tuning::TuningInstanceMultiCrit) terminated tuning instance. tuner (TunerEAGGA) tuner optimized instance. model_uhash (character(1) character string representing unique hash (uhash) model reconstructed. See instance$archive$data$uhash possible values.

title: Reconstructs an EAGGA model from a Tuning Instance — reconstruct_eagga_model
text: reconstructed EAGGA model form (mlr3::Learner) passed construction mlr3tuning::TuningInstanceMultiCrit trained full mlr3::Task.

title: Reconstructs an EAGGA model from a Tuning Instance — reconstruct_eagga_model
text: function reconstructs EAGGA model observed tuning specified unique hash extracting necessary information provided mlr3tuning::TuningInstanceMultiCrit TunerEAGGA object. clones learner task tuning instance, sets learner's hyperparameter values according values logged archive matching given unique hash model trains learner task. Note random seed specified construction TunerEAGGA (via seed_calculate_proxy_measures parameter), exact reconstruction may possible. learner trained complete task, model can readily used new data. longer used performance estimation unless access another task containing hold-test data seen tuning.
